alert.note: Alert for Bleckley; Pulaski (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 8:51PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Jones, Twiggs, Bibb and Monroe Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Bleckley and Pulaski Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Dublin affecting Wilkinson, Washington, Johnson and Laurens Counties. Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 26 feet, Moderate flooding begins...with several homes surrounded by flood waters and at least 3 homes begin flooding near Gooseneck Lane and RiverView Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 17.8 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to a crest of 26.9 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
